course.subject: GBUS
course.name: From Zero to Exit â€“ Journey of a Start-up
course.description: This course is designed for students who are interested in starting a business or working for an entrepreneurial company. Taking an experiential learning approach, the course is designed in a project-based learning to give students a taste of being a real entrepreneur. Students are expected to experience their own start up journey, from coming up with their own start up idea to incepting the idea, pitching for funding and to growing their own start-up. At the end of the course, they will be equipped with the skills and knowledge necessary to kick start their business as an entrepreneur. For GBUS students.

reviews.author: pp2601
reviews.comment_content: Very shallow content about general entrepreneurship which is quite useless and everyone who has a bit of understanding of how startups work will already know this. Every lecture has a guest speaker of varying quality. Some of the guest lectures are quite interesting although timewise they are really tight so often times there is not enough time to do detailed questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: Joseph teaches quite interactive and is always open for discussions. He sometimes just picks some random ppl in the lecture hall to answer the question so you should always pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was kind of bad which is really not understandable in my opinion since the group project which makes up the majority of the grading is kinda arbitrary.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. There is no real preparation needed for the lectures. There is an essay about a topic Joseph chooses in the middle of the semester which you can easily get done in a day or two. The main hustle is the final presentation and report which needs some time and effort to prepare.

reviews.author: BigBenChung
reviews.comment_teaching: Interactive teaching. Joseph is a really cool guy and he emphasizes a lot on your willingness to learn rather than your performance.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is considered somewhat heavy towards the middle/end of the semester. The workload throughout the semester is acceptable, with one short essay and a 5-min homework per week. The final project requires quite a lot of time to do if you would like to perform well. However the project is fun in general so it does not feel very stressful while doing it.

reviews.author: KennyKennyKenny
reviews.title: Best course ever
reviews.comment_content: The content is straight forward and clear without all the theories taught in other business classes. The good things is that you can challenge Joseph for the content and we can have a discussion in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Joseph is a cool guy, his class is never boring and always have discussion. Joseph speaks pretty fast but also very clear, you are also welcome to ask at any time, so you don't have to worry about if it is too fast for you.
The good thing is, every class Joseph will invite a speaker ,who is so what related to the topic he taught in that class, to give a speech about the topic. That makes the whole learning experience more interesting and deeper because the speaker always give us some insight related to the topic or industry.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A- for the course without doing anything special.
In the beginning of the semester, Joseph said we have to be active in the class(~50% class participation wtfff) and hand in homework on time so to get a decent grade. And the final presentation is also important. But for me, I rarely speak in class and was not the best in presentation. The only thing I think I was doing great is that I show my passion toward startup and asking tons of questions about my final presentation project when I have the chance to have a face-to-face mentoring with him.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost 0 workload lol.
You are required to hand in a pre-class preparation that you need to write down the questions you want to ask in the next class.
The only big thing is the final presentation and business proposal. They do take a while to finish.

reviews.author: Jiong
reviews.comment_content: This course is really good if you are interested in start-ups. It will answer all the questions. How should I start? What will I face in the future? How should I choose? What should I pay more attention to? Where should I go? There will be a guest speaker who is professional in the certain area giving a talk about a specific topic every day. I like this kind of teaching model very much.
reviews.comment_teaching: Joseph is a good speaker overall. He likes to make his students think for the answer themselves first.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading depends much on your final presentation, reflection paper and class participation because it doesn't have any exams or assignment anyway.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload actually, just a final presentation and a little work before every class.
